entries.meaning: A strong feeling of displeasure, hostility or antagonism towards someone or something, usually combined with an urge to harm, often stemming from perceived provocation, hurt, or threat.
examples: You need to control your anger.

verbs.description: anger (third-person singular simple present angers, present participle angering, simple past and past participle angered)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To cause such a feeling of antagonism in.
examples: Synonyms: enrage, infuriate, annoy, vex, grill, displease, aggravate, irritate
He who angers you conquers you.
Synonym: get angry (see angry for more)
